name: The Revolution
description:
'''The Revolution''' is an American band formed in [[Minneapolis]], Minnesota, in 1979 by [[Prince (musician)|Prince]], serving as his live band and later as his studio band. The band's sound incorporated [[Rock music|rock]], [[Funk music|funk]], [[rhythm and blues|R&B]], [[New wave music|new wave]], [[synthpop]] and [[Psychedelic music|psychedelia]] elements. Along with Prince's other projects, the Revolution helped create the [[Minneapolis sound]]. By the time of their 1986 breakup, the Revolution had backed Prince on two studio albums, two soundtracks and two videos.

After making its studio album debut on ''[[1999 (Prince album)|1999]]'' (1982), the Revolution rose to international fame with ''[[Purple Rain (album)|Purple Rain]]'' (1984), which reached number one on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and became certified [[RIAA certification|13× Platinum]] by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). The band achieved its second number-one ''Billboard'' 200 album with ''[[Around the World in a Day]]'' in 1985. They charted six top 10 singles on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] chart, including three number-ones: "[[Let's Go Crazy]]", "[[When Doves Cry]]" and "[[Kiss (Prince song)|Kiss]]".

The Revolution officially disbanded in 1986 after the [[Hit n Run – Parade Tour]], which supported ''[[Parade (Prince album)|Parade]]'', the soundtrack for ''[[Under the Cherry Moon]]'', but following [[Death of Prince|Prince's death]] in 2016, the band announced reunion shows. The Revolution has won three [[Grammy Awards]].
